Just keep it simple and quit over-developing.

title: Recent update from May 2025

Great features of the app, but updates of removing iconic "heart" symbol in linking musing and other stuff. And now instead of pressing "your library" I tend to press create albums which already have their feature at the top of the screen. Can the developers look into this? 

This little gestures with unnecessary updates are quite confusing. Best option would be to allow users to create their home screen, like in an iPhone, you can move the icons. Same can be possibly implemented too. 

Wish you all some creativity;)!

title: Irresponsible adâ€™s on free version
review:
Iâ€™ve used Spotify for years now and while itâ€™s good for a diverse range of music listening, Iâ€™ve found when using the free version, there are quite a few re-occurring issues.
I find it extremely irresponsible on Spotify's part to push horror and thriller movie trailer ads without any warning, playing in between songs.
Since ads are no longer skip-able after 5 seconds, nor are there content ratings (such as G, PG, M, ect), people driving and other hands free listeners can be jump scared when these unexpected and sometimes disturbing ads pop up (Potentially causing accidents on the road).
Furthermore, there are no trigger warnings for those who may be (understandably) sensitive to certain themes.
Even though the premium version is ad free, it doesnâ€™t sit well with me that users may have to pay just to avoid this potentially harmful situation.

This is only one problem, among MANY that I hope Spotify decides to listen to and take the time to amend.

title: A Fantastic Alternative to Spotify
review:
My Opinion:

Iâ€™ve been using SoundCloud for over 8 years, and I can say with certainty that it is my favorite place to listen to music.

A more in-depth review will show how comparable it is to other platforms, and how it could rival that of even Spotify. 

Compare and Contrast:

First thing I want to make clear is that this section will focus mainly on the comparison between SoundCloud and Spotify as I do not harbor much experience with other platforms. (Pandora, Amazon Music, etc.) 

Secondly, no, SoundCloud is not just a 1:1 recreation of Spotify with tiny adjustments. 

In fact, the two platforms differ vastly in feature richness as well as their goals. This simply means SoundCloud may have features that Spotify doesnâ€™t and vice versa, but what makes a music platform appealing is what they offer to their users. 

Sure, Spotify may have certain features over SoundCloud, for example lyrics, video, and such, but SoundCloud has always put its listeners convenience over novelty. 

Despite not having newer features, SoundCloud still puts in the necessary baseline features to make listening enjoyable. 

The overwhelming support given to artists/creators has been a staple to SoundCloudâ€™s brand to this day. They ensure their priorities are in line with everyoneâ€™s goals. 

Regarding Ads, yes, the app still has ads for free listening. The leniency on ad breaks is fair but not great. 

Although, what Spotify lacked long ago is what SoundCloud has made up forâ€”specifically functionality!

SoundCloud may have had frequent ads, but Spotify used to give free listeners highly restricted functionality on its platform. 

SoundCloud didnâ€™t have this problem. The fact that free listeners were limited to only a few skips or repeats, whatâ€™s worse, wait an extra day before they refreshed is unbelievable! SoundCloud gave this to listeners from the get go as far back as launch. This includes free skips, loops, scanning, all of it all day everyday. 

\\\ /// IMPORTANT! \\\ ///

One caveat I will mention, however, is that most labeled artist will be locked behind a premium but everything else is free.

/// \\\ /// \\\         /// \\\ /// \\\

One last thing, and this  bit is partial biased, but I prefer the recommendations on SoundCloud better. They just know what I like. As in, not only do they play songs Iâ€™ve already listened to, but they bring me new songs and artists Iâ€™ve never ever heard of that sound shockingly in tune to what I listen to on the regular. So it has helped me develop my musical taste.

TL:DR

Conclusions:

Should you use SoundCloud?

In short, 

If you like free casual listening, yeah, absolutely. Itâ€™s a great option for a great time.

If you want rich innovative features, no, not really. The app is better suited for an audience of regulars, rather than an audience of mixtape DJs

If you took the time to read this entire review, thens many thanks to you for reading. 

Hopefully this gave you some insight and inspires you to try the app for yourself.

title: Declining UI in favour of pumping revenue
review:
Spotify has been going downhill for a while with its constant updates that make the UI far more complex than needs be. However they have now resorted to shamelessly pushing favoured music/podcast to the front and burying anything remotely tailored to your actual taste/music history to the back. The amount of mindless junk food podcasts that are now front and centre on my home page is astounding. Will be giving Apple Music a go, even YouTube with zero ads seems tempting.

A shame, Iâ€™ve been a user for over a decade now.

title: Un-Installing as we speakâ€¦ but why??
review: Because of me going through my library, and I get an ad for premium, okay thatâ€™s alright, then proceeded to scroll through my library and couldnâ€™t find my song. so I press the search button, and not one, not two, not three, BUT SIX UN-SKIPPABLE ADS!? and get this, they werenâ€™t just 30 second adsâ€¦ THEY WERE 60-120 SECOND ADS?! I HAVE NOT PLAYED A SONG YET! WHY AM I GETTING 7 ADS FOR OPENING YOUR DUMB APP?!? Wouldâ€™ve sat there for more than 6 MINUTES to search up 4 letters, and listen to a song THATS 2 MINUTES LONG. Installing SoundCloud - itâ€™s only has 1, 20 second ads EVERY 30 MINUTES. And yet most of the time they leave you alone, and itâ€™s ONLY one every one hour, AND WHY IS PREMUIM 15$??? I remember it was 4.49. SoundCloud actually supports their artists and doesnâ€™t rip off the community, SoundCloud premium is still pricy, but ITS 45% LESS THAN SPOTIFY, AND I GET OVER 18 MILLION CUSTOM ARTIST AND SONGS FOR ONLY 7$, and artists actually GET PAID.

title: Audiobook rip off
review:
WHY DO I NEED TO BUY A TOP-UP TO LISTEN TO AUDIOBOOKS!? 
Have been using Spotify and paying my premium subscription for years. Recently I have gotten into audiobooks, and use Spotify for these usually with no issue.  I have started a new job working 12 hour night shifts and love having an audiobook on in the background. Imagine my disgust when my listening is interrupted and I am told to buy a top up to keep listening! 
I have the best subscription available and now have to pay ANOTHER Â£9 to get 10 more hours of listening time! (Thatâ€™s not even a full shift of listening!) Which, by the way, Iâ€™m not able to do within the app itself. 
Guess Iâ€™ll just have listen to Joe F^<king Rogan podcasts now.
Totally shameful and disappointing cash grab. 
Premium not premium (Amazon effect).
I will not be buying â€œtop upsâ€ out of principle.

title: TIDAL Removes Core Functionality That Once Set It Apart
review: After the 2 latest updates, TIDAL removed one of the features I relied on most: the ability to view and follow composers through the credits. It is now only possible to follow performing artists and view tracks they appear on â€” a significant downgrade. This was one of TIDALâ€™s few distinguishing features, especially considering that its music recommendations are noticeably weaker than Spotifyâ€™s. The composer tracking feature helped bridge that gap. Now, with only audio quality remaining â€” which is also available on platforms like Apple Music. Whatâ€™s even more frustrating is that the changelog stated the update only included bug fixes, without any mention of the removal of such core functionality. This lack of transparency undermines user trust. Adding to the confusion, when you search for a composer, they still appear in the search results â€” often with a brief description under their name indicating their role as a songwriter, producer, or engineer. However, tapping on their name leads to a near-empty profile displaying the message: â€œArtist profile is empty. This artist hasnâ€™t released any tracks. Follow them to be notified if they do.â€ Itâ€™s baffling and frankly misleading. Why have you deleted all composers profiles TIDAL!? Several of my friends recently switched to TIDAL specifically because of the ability to follow songwriters. Removing one of the platformâ€™s most valuable and unique features is not only short-sighted â€” itâ€™s outright self-sabotaging.

title: Meh

Downloads for playlists can take months, no lie I have playlists that are six months old that havenâ€™t finished downloading. shuffle sucks, it plays the same shuffled songs every time even though these playlists have 500 or so songs. And most aggravating, apparently the folks at Tidal have no idea of how to even out the playback volume of different songs. Thereâ€™s a setting for it but it doesnâ€™t do anything. Overall pretty mediocre and Iâ€™ll be switching back to the first streaming app I used.

title: Not true bit-perfect lossless audio. Price too high.

The lossless audio files used by Apple Music are not true ALAC files, but are movpkg files, a package of audio fragments that are pieced together on the fly as they are played back. This means they are not bit-perfect replications of the 16- or 24-bit studio masters and cannot be played back in anything other than Apple Music. This is such a shame for paying customers because it means DRM is back worse than ever before with Apple Music audio.
Because of these issues, the monthly subscription price is unjustifiably high. Iâ€™ll be looking elsewhere for true lossless audio downloads until Apple corrects this misleading â€œfeatureâ€.
You almost got it right, Apple. Disappointing.

Von den anfangs vollmundig versprochenen professionell kuratierten Playlists ist nichts mehr geblieben. Ich habe den Einsruck, dass sie nicht die Nutzerinteressen wiederspiegeln sondern vielmehr die finanziellen Interessen der Firma (wenig Tantieme) kein Vergleich zu Spotify. Ansonsten findet sich alles, wer gerne eigene Musikzusammenstellungen hÃ¶rt, ist damit gut bedient. Vor allem die Integration in die Apple-Hardwarewelt lÃ¤sst kaum WÃ¼nsche offen. Besondere ErwÃ¤hnung verdient hier der inklusive Lossless Service. @Apple: Bitte lasst Euch mit den Playlists etwas einfallen.

title: Please Add True Gapless Playback to Apple Music
review: Apple Music still lacks proper gapless playback, a basic feature expected by any serious music listener. Albums that are meant to flow seamlessly (like live recordings or concept albums) are ruined by tiny but noticeable gaps between tracks. Competing players handle this perfectly, even on the same device. For a premium service, this should be standard. Please prioritize this in a future updateâ€”itâ€™s long overdue.

title: At home and at ease with Deezer
review: I canâ€™t remember how or why I got involved with Deezer but I can say Iâ€™m happy we came together.  Like many others Iâ€™ve tried a variety of streaming services: Apple destroyed my own music collection, Spotify for me was messy and cluttered, it was difficult to get to the music.  Naive maybe but I never went along with the notion these services could serve up more of what you enjoy.  Possibly it was  because Iâ€™d never stayed long enough.  Now Iâ€™ve been with Deezer for several years, I feel at ease and the music just keeps coming home.  Itâ€™s the music that matters and Deezer provides it in a calm uncluttered environment.

title: Esta es mi reseÃ±a sobre tidal y su aplicaciÃ³n
review:
Hola, me llamo JuliÃ¡n y soy un audiofilo, a diferencia de muchos usuarios que han dejado aquÃ­ la reseÃ±a que por lo que escribieron me hacen pensar que son usuarios comunes, o voy a hacer estar crÃ­tica desde el lado audifilo
Tengo varios auriculares dedicados: focal utopia, fiio fx17, campfire astrolith, Chord mojo 2, angel earmen, xduo tubular etcâ€¦ me parece que el sonido de tidal es realmente bueno, si lo comparo con Qobuz parece ligeramente mÃ¡s cÃ¡lido, prefiero Tidal que Qobuz porque su catÃ¡logo es mÃ¡s grande y tengo mÃ¡s canciones, ademÃ¡s actualmente ya no usan MQA por lo cual es otra razÃ³n que me hace decantarme por tidal y no por otras palabras plataformas de mÃºsica, pero e visto un fallo que es realmente crÃ­tico y muy importante, resulta que cuando pongo el iPhone a reproducir mÃºsica conectado a mi dac mojo 2 parece ser que despuÃ©s de terminar la pista no actualiza la frecuencia en su siguiente pistaâ€¦ y siempre se queda marcando la frecuencia de la primera pista cuando le di a reproducir mis playlist de mÃºsica, al principio pensÃ© que quizÃ¡s era ese dac que no actualiza de forma independiente la frecuencia al empezar la otra prisa asÃ­ que realice la prueba con 4 dac/amp diferentes y no actualizaba al frecuencia, solo actualiza cuando yo de forma manual desbloqueo el iPhone y le doy a avanzar la pista para empezar a reproducir la siguiente pista, en ese caso sÃ­ que todos marcaban la nueva pista con la resoluciÃ³n correcta a la que estaba grabadaâ€¦ eso es un fallo muy grave para una aplicaciÃ³n basada en la mejor calidad de audio y es la Ãºnica de todas las aplicaciones de mÃºsica actuales que tiene ese falloâ€¦ deberÃ­an hacer una correcciÃ³n del error en una nueva versiÃ³n lo antes posibleâ€¦

title: Disappointed

There is â€œTuneinâ€ {looks like an account created by a corporation}content and listening to anything by them, has ads! Its â€™liveâ€™
Completely disappointed. And no way to complain or report in the app.

Searching for â€˜Liveâ€™ shows is clumsy.
The AI music curator is completely predictable. Itâ€™s a 1, 2, 3â€¦ cycle of anything you have favourited. 1 playlist, 2 playlist, 3 playlist. Repeat.
Furthermore the â€œcreate a stationâ€ option on a song, will morph into a category completely unrelated to ANYTHING you would choose, and often, stuff personally would be called â€œplay less of this.â€

Very annoying systems on Apple Music.

Itâ€™s tough to navigate and discover unfamiliar music. As an example, if I listen to â€™Loungeâ€™ genre, itâ€™s difficult to locate any â€œClassicalâ€ genre music. If I NEVER want to play â€œRapâ€ the app FORCES Rap genre music to play regardless. Several functions that are extremely disappointing.

Apple Musik ist genial, lossless Ã¼ber Kabel bei meinen Momentum 4, das ist einfach genial, der EQ stimmte von der ersten Sekunde perfekt und ist meiner Meinung nach auch genreabhÃ¤ngig angepasst. Find ich total geil. 

Ich fÃ¼hle alles so viel mehr, als bei Spotify. Ich speise den Algorithmus zwar auch stÃ¤ndig, aber ich hÃ¶re immer wieder Lieder, die ich so gar nicht auf dem Schirm hatte. Apple trifft damit immer den richtigen Nerv!

Okayâ€¦gut, Spotify ist auch gut, ja und die meisten Leute legen auf die Punkte die ich angesprochen habe auch nicht so viel Wert. Aber wenn einem hochauflÃ¶sende, perfekt abgestimmte Musik, ein inspirierender Algorithmus und dass zu dem gleichen Preis wie bei Spotifyâ€¦wo das alles nicht annÃ¤hernd so gut lÃ¤uft. Kann Apple Music nur empfehlen!

Und Apple spendiert meistens 3 Monate Probelaufzeitâ€¦.ein weiterer groÃŸer Pluspunkt!

title: Best music app
review: As a spotify user for many years of my life, Iâ€™ve recently made the switch to Apple Music after using my 3 months free trial because let me tell you - the audio quality is insane and I cried listening to some of my favourite songs because I literally heard sounds I never even knew existed, the layering, the lows and highs are all so perfect and beautiful to my ears. Now I canâ€™t even listen to Spotify because the audio quality on apple music is just 100 times better, you can really hear everything crispy and clear. I also love how they have Dolby atmos integrated and the Spatial Audio works better than the spotify one because the Apple Music one just sounds more clear and the bass is more rich. I usually donâ€™t pay to listen to music but Apple Music is such a game changer so if your looking to hear some super high quality, rich in bass type of audio - Apple Music is def the go to!

title: Abysmal performance
review:
Has the best selection (at least for my tastes), good sound quality, a reasonable price now, and I donâ€™t mind the recommendation system. But the search system is horrendous- the worst Iâ€™ve seen, the worst I could imagine, the worst I could imagine imagining. Itâ€™s easier to find a playlist, click on an artist, go to their page, find the related artists, find an artist in that list, go through their albums, and find the song youâ€™re looking for than to search for that song.
Update: the app has gotten much, much worse over the last six months or so. When I have a perfect internet signal and every single other app on my phone works perfectly, Tidal struggles. More often that not, I have to refresh a page to load it. This is beyond unacceptable and if it is not fixed soon I will switch to a different streaming platform, even though Tidal is the best option in almost every other way.

title: Ideal for pop quizzes
review:
This is a great app I discovered years ago as I couldnâ€™t always remember the title of a song, and once you download Shazam, thereâ€™s no going back! I have even suggested it to friends who also love music, who also couldnâ€™t remember a song title, and they were impressed!

There are still occasional songs which, as popular as they are, donâ€™t always get â€œpicked upâ€ by Shazam, and this can be quite frustrating!

Other than that, itâ€™s a great app and I would be lost without it!

title: getting worse and worse
review:
Soundcloud has been my music app of choice for many years but the free experience has been progressively getting worse every year.

There are an insane amount of ads now, it is easily becoming comparable to spotify. There are plenty of ads that totally freeze up the app and on restart you are given another entire ad to watch. If the app is open (like when choosing songs) you get video only ads which cannot be listened to in the background, totally ridiculous for a music app that people typically use cell data for. 

Incredibly frustrating, especially when the website is so fantastic.

title: Amazing Audio but Very Slow App
review: Tidal has amazing audio. You can hear the difference between other music platforms but the app is so infuriating. Yes, the interface is clean and looks good but it has a delay whenever clicking on a song. I get logged out at the most random times. Music stops playing because I get a â€œno internet connectionâ€ when I do. Since I canâ€™t log in at times, I have to log in through the website which is even more infuriating.

title: Good in Theory, Hardly Functions in Practice
review:
I switched to Tidal mainly because of their higher royalty rate to artists, and compatibility with 3rd Party DJ apps. But the bugginess of the app is so frustrating, I oftentimes canâ€™t use it at all. Today alone I have deleted and reinstalled the app three times just to make it play again. And even now the login page is set to an infinite loop that wonâ€™t let me log in. Good in principle but so unreliable its incredibly frustrating.

PROS
+ Pays Higher Royalty Rate to Artists

+ Compatible with DJ Apps (for extra fee ğŸ˜’)

+ High Fidelity Streaming

+ Good â€œSimilar toâ€ Shuffle Algorithm

CONS
- Frustratingly buggy for a major platform

- Higher Cost

- Has much difficulty connecting to devices (ie. Chromecast)

- Often unable to load or play music for unknown reasons

- Incompatible with Siri (can ask her to play Spotify but not Tidal)

title: Crashes AVR
review:
Deze app laat mijn Marantz AVR Cinema 60 crashen. Eindelijk dacht ik een goed geluid te hebben, want dat is nu wel zeer goed. Maar nu raakt de AVR van slag. Meestal resulteert dat in een luid buzz kabaal en kan ik mijn Marantz niet meer bedienen, of start ie vanzelf opnieuw op. 

Lijkt me niet gezond en ik durf de app nu niet meer te gebruiken. Ik ben bang dat de boel kapot gaat. 

Via de HEOS app kan ik nog wel via Tidal streamen. Maar dat is een rudimentair gebeuren. De update begin mei 2025 heeft geen verbetering gebracht. 

De helpdesk van TIDAL kan je niet verder helpen. Waarschijnlijk ligt het probleem bij een verkeerde implementatie van â€˜Tidal Connectâ€™ door Marantz. En hebben veel andere bezitters van soortgelijke apparaten bij Marantz er last van.  Dat vertelde hÃºn helpdesk. Wees voorlopig daarom maar even voorzichtig met deze app. Ook al kan TIDAL er zelf waarschijnlijk niets aan doen. 

Van twee sterren naar 1 met deze app.

title: Apple Music Review: The Pinnacle of Audio Streaming Excellence
review:
Apple Music stands out as the best music streaming application for true audiophiles and casual listeners alike. With its lossless audio quality and Dolby Atmos support, it offers an immersive sound experience that brings every beat and melody to life. Whether youâ€™re using high-end headphones or Appleâ€™s own AirPods, the clarity and depth are unmatched.

What truly sets Apple Music apart is its seamless integration with Appleâ€™s ecosystem. From haptic feedback to lyric-based voice control through Siri, every interaction feels intuitive and polished. The real-time lyrics feature, paired with vocal isolation and control, makes karaoke-style listening both fun and engaging.

title: The best app ever
review:
Firstly, I am truly grateful to the developers and founders for this incredible music platform that continues to grow and improve.
Secondly, I want to thank you for supporting Ukraine by opening Premium access to users from this country â€” that gesture was incredibly important back then and still means a lot today.
Thirdly, the presence and intensity of ads is a standard practice in all apps used without a premium subscription â€” not just music apps. People work, people support the service, people get paid. So if youâ€™re not paying for a subscription, youâ€™re â€œpayingâ€ by listening to ads. Unfortunately, thatâ€™s how it works â€” always and without exception.

Your recommendation algorithms, curated suggestions, playlist creation features, the ability to share music with friends â€” all of it is top-tier. If it wasnâ€™t like this five years ago, it definitely works now, and it works well. You can tell the team cares, works hard on the product, and keeps moving forward.

Thank you for your support, for an amazing product, and for giving us a way to escape reality from time to time ;)

Youâ€™re amazing guys!

title: Design issue with recent update
review:
In general, I absolutely love Deezer for how many new artists I've discovered that I never would have without it. Iâ€™ve been a premium subscriber for well over ten years now. 

Generally the app works pretty well, but I do have one gripe at the moment, a result of a recent redesign. Please reinstate the button at the centre of the player screen (above the play button, think it was an ellipsis housed in a circle) from where you could select the artist, album, add to playlist etc. Youâ€™ve moved this menu to the ellipsis at the top right of the screen, which is way too far away (with how big phones are these days) when whizzing through the app/checking out similar artists/trying to rapidly build new playlists. 

Itâ€™s also a bit laggy with searches at the moment, Iâ€™m finding it often takes several attempts to get the cursor to show in the search bar. Loading of the app when offline, even offline playlists, also often takes quite a while. 

Other than these points, big fan.

title: Price is a joke
review:
You have got to kidding with the prices you are offering for Australian subscribers? $20 a week is the cheapest, thatâ€™s the same price as my gym membership.
Also really really annoying you can not skip the â€˜choose 15 artistsâ€™ why am I being forced to do anything? Which Mr music app developer thought that was a clever idea? I have no idea who I like or who I want to like I donâ€™t want to be told that I must like and follow anyone especially not a ridiculous amount like 15.
In settings you can go in and remove those 15 artists however it then adds them to the excluded list so youll never hear anything from them, so you delete them from the excluded list and guess what? Itâ€™s adds it back to the recommendations list!!!
Wake up to yourself.
Cancelling my subscription and deleting the app.

title: Love everything about Apple Musicâ€¦ butâ€¦
review:
I havenâ€™t ever used any other music service outside of Apple for over 20 years! Love the intuitiveness, the large selection of music, and ability to find new music through continuous play.

But!! Why canâ€™t I favourite a radio station anymore??? I generally want to listen to my local(ish) ABC station or channels I donâ€™t get where I live, and recently, Iâ€™m always having to search for them. You used be able to favourite them, or find them in recently played. Maybe Iâ€™m just missing something, and maybe itâ€™s not a big deal for most, I just find it a real shame that this is isnâ€™t something that has been maintained. Thanks for your time.

Murray

Ich hÃ¶re gerne und viel Musik. Gerne auch querbeet. Meine Lieblingssongs sind seit Jahren gewachsen und haben eine fast fÃ¼nfstellige Anzahl. 

Dennoch bekommt es Deezer nicht hin, mir im Flow Musik zu hÃ¶ren die ich mag oder nicht schon 1000x gehÃ¶rt habe. 

Nein. Im Flow wird Random Weihnachtsmusik gespielt. Das im FrÃ¼hling. Da guckst nicht schlecht. 

Oder jedes dritte Lied ist von den typischen Mallorca Schubladen. 
Nein! Wie oft soll ich denn noch auswÃ¤hlen das ich diesen Titel oder gar KÃ¼nstler nicht hÃ¶ren mÃ¶chte? Es spielt mir diese Tracks immer und immer wieder.

At least you could have a little â€œspirituality sectionâ€ on the â€œRadio (((â€¢)))â€ section of the app. Where you put Buddhist, Muslim, Christian, New Age, Atheist/ Rationalist, Hindu, Taoist, etc. content. I would appreciate it and would make me consider buying a subscription. If youâ€™re still reading, again, I acknowledge the potential flashback. review: TIDAL ist im Grunde eine wirklich gute App. Die grafische Aufarbeitung ist toll, die Wiedergabeleistung ebenfalls. Ich nutze TIDAL sehr intensiv und hÃ¶re darauf in allen Variationen, zu Hause Ã¼ber Streaming, selbst im Auto Ã¼ber den Offline Modusâ€¦. Und genau hier beginnt es mit dem â€ABERâ€œ. Den im Grunde nutze ich sobald ich zu Hause verlasse wirklich alles Ã¼ber den Offline Modus, denn ich will unterwegs einfach nicht streamen, aufgrund dessen das wenn ich das mobil tun muss ich immerzu den mobilen Funk oder ein W-LAN aktiviert haben muss, was ich aufgrund der enormen dauernden Strahlenbelastung nicht will. (UND ja, Mobilfunk, W-LAN ist schÃ¤dlich, die Studienlage weltweit ist erdrÃ¼ckend) Nun muss wirklich bei jedem Mal wenn man den Flugmodus irgendwo aktiviert und man will offline Musik hÃ¶ren die Anmeldeprozedur erneuert werden, sonst werden die Offline gespeicherten Playlisten nicht angezeigt und nicht gespielt. Das nervt enorm, denn das kommt einfach tÃ¤glich vor, wenn man eben das Smartphone immer wieder in den Flugmodus versetzt. Will man dann Musik offline gespeichert genieÃŸen, geht das bei TIDAL einfach nicht, weil man immerzu prÃ¼ft, hat der oder die gute den nun wirklich gezahltâ€¦.. ja habe ich, aber jeden Tag mehrfach diese Prozedur durchfÃ¼hren ist einfach Ã¤rgerlich. Vor nicht zu langer Zeit (1,2 Jahre) konnte man dies bei TIDAL noch anders regeln und die Prozedur war dann vielleicht einmal im Monat fÃ¤llig, was auch im Grunde wirklich reichen wÃ¼rde. Hier ist TIDAL einfach Ã¼berhaupt nicht benutzerfreundlich und es wÃ¤re enorm super, wÃ¼rde man zu dieser Praxis wieder zurÃ¼ck kehren. DENN, wie TIDAL nutzt, steigt hier i.d.R. nicht ein und aus und somit wÃ¤re der einmalige Check pro Monat bzgl. Der Offline Thematik vollkommen ausreichend. TIDAL aufwachen bitte, danke.

title: From a First-Time User & Former Spotify Listener
review:
As a longtime Spotify user, I decided to give TIDAL a shot out of curiosityâ€”and honestly, Iâ€™m glad I did. The first thing that stood out to me was the sound quality. TIDALâ€™s HiFi and Master tracks really do sound noticeably better, especially with good headphones or speakers. Itâ€™s one of those things you donâ€™t realize youâ€™re missing until you hear it.

The interface is clean and easy to navigate. It took a minute to adjust after coming from Spotify, but it wasnâ€™t a difficult switch at all. I actually found the music discovery and editorial playlists really solidâ€”maybe even more thoughtful and intentional than Spotifyâ€™s algorithm-based ones.

I also like that TIDAL seems to put more emphasis on the artists. Thereâ€™s a sense of curation and respect for the music that I didnâ€™t always feel on Spotify. And knowing that TIDAL pays artists more fairly is definitely a plus.

That said, Spotify still has the edge when it comes to social features and some integrations (like lyrics syncing and playlist sharing). But for pure music listening, TIDAL has been a really refreshing change. Iâ€™ve been enjoying it a lot more than I expected.

If you care about audio quality and a more artist-driven experience, itâ€™s definitely worth the switch.

title: AGHHHHHH
review:
Deezer i have been your ride or die for years, whilst my friends threw rotten tomatoes and laughed at me for not using Spotify I stood by you like a mother with their child, I feel a motherly love for Deezer but right now I am very close to putting you up for adoption 
I was about to have my nightly routine of listening to music when I click on the downloaded music flooded andâ€¦what is this? Where is my downloaded music? The only option is shuffle my music? What if I donâ€™t want to shuffle my music? Then what? Am I kicked out the Deezer squad? Is this a cool kids only club? 

I am heartbroken, the only way to see all my music now is through the playlist option but that just looks mad ugly and I donâ€™t trust it Deezer please sort this out I miss my downloaded music, speaking of which if I go into Deezer without having already connected to the internet or 4G my favourite tracks wonâ€™t load and Iâ€™m stupid and when I was nine I put all my music onto my favourite tracks and itâ€™s been six years and I might as well keep going. So when I have no internet not only does my favourite tracks playlist not loadâ€¦but neither does my downloaded music folder (not that I would need it since it would just tell me to shuffle my music (I donâ€™t want to do that)) 

Deezer please sort this out or I am thinking about disowning you as a member of my music family and telling my friends about how bad you are and we all point and laugh â€œDeezer is stupidâ€ we all chant in unisonâ€¦ If you donâ€™t want that then I recommend you do something about this or I might just join my friends on Spotify and feel out of placeâ€¦Deezer feels like my second home, However just like my actual home there are a lot of problems 

Why is this app so laggy? Ever since there was this ugly app update that made the logo a purple heart Iâ€™ve wanted to rip my own less purple heart out every time I go on the app 

Itâ€™s so laggy I genuinely went to get my battery replaced once because I thought it was on me 

Everything is so laggy and takes so long to load It almost feels like bullying, like youâ€™re making fun of me
 â€œhah, look at her waiting for all her music, she probably listens to horrible musicâ€ you all point and laugh at meâ€¦ Honestly I love this app, thatâ€™s why Iâ€™ve taken at least 10 minutes of my life to write this, but genuinely sort this out, I did just find out Deezer is a French ran company so maybe that explains it but this app just feels so laggy, I feel like Spotify is smashing my phone all the time to try force me to switch to them every time I go on this app and experience the worst lag of my life But me and Deezer have a blood brothers bond that no one can break, apart from my broken phone after I tap my screen so hard to load a song my screen cracks â€œno Deezerâ€¦â€ I cry as my phone explodes and the colour it explodes into is the green from the Spotify logo Back to the shuffle thing Who still shuffles these days? I went to my friend to ask her, this is how it went â€œDo you shuffle?â€ â€œHuh?â€ â€œOn Deezer? Do you shuffle your music?-â€œ She body slammed me to the floor and called out for everyone to see me â€œLook! She still uses Deezer in 2024!â€ I cried No one shuffles anymore, but people do still listen to downloaded music. So why is this gone? I actually feel like a part of me left when I saw the only option was so shuffle, do you know what that does to a person? I would really appreciate it if you could sort this out, whenever I walk past people now they make me do a shuffle and point and laugh at me as I canâ€™t shuffle very well because Iâ€™ve only done one dance class in my life and I just wasnâ€™t very good, itâ€™s personal I donâ€™t really want to get into it Iâ€™m tired of being called shuffle girl. Iâ€™m tired of not seeing my downloaded music, Iâ€™m speaking for the masses now as I ride around on my horse and chanting what all Deezer users want â€œBring back the downloaded music option folder and make it less laggy and also please make it so I donâ€™t have to already be connected to Wi-Fi to go on my favourite tracks!â€ I chant as the village cheers me onâ€¦I am then stopped by the Spotify guards, I bet they donâ€™t have to deal with this, the evil Spotify thoughts are talking over. I think the only way to get them to go away is to do what I asked in this review, â€œstop her!â€ Spotify yells as I use Deezerâ€¦ The evil Spotify thoughts have now lead me into a deep spiral as I sit in my cell. I donâ€™t know if I mentioned but I got arrested for still using Deezer and have daily tomatoes thrown at me shaped as the Deezer logo so I feel embarrassed and ashamed I can never feel ashamed of my child Deezer As I look out my cell walls and scratch III onto the cell walls I wonder what itâ€™s like to be a Spotify user â€œStopâ€ I hear a voice say I turn Itâ€™s BeyoncÃ©, my most listened to artist â€œBeyoncÃ© Giselle Knowles? My most listened to artist with 96 hours? Oh my goodness!â€ She laughed at me Deezer you made BeyoncÃ© laugh at me What the hell Deezer? â€œIf you used Spotify you would have been able to listen to me more because you wouldnâ€™t have wasted valuable minutes waiting for the app to loadâ€ She exploded into the Spotify green and I was left alone in my cell again Iâ€™ve fallen into a spiral, all I want is my downloaded music, downloaded music on my non laggy music app I look out my cell window and see a future, not a green Spotify capitalist future, but a beautiful purple one for Deezer, full of baguettes and snails (youâ€™re french run) Deezer I see a beautiful future, but it takes small steps â€œIf only Deezer wasnâ€™t laggyâ€¦â€ I sigh A guard then comes into my cell He talks to me about how if I reset my phone maybe this would sort itself out, but I know my Deezer better than that, I know Deezer isnâ€™t as simple as resetting my phone Deezer You are like my child, and right now youâ€™re going through a weird rebellious emo phase and itâ€™s lead to me being arrested and laughed at by BeyoncÃ© and laughed at by people and having tomatoes thrown at me â€œDeezer will be fixed!â€ I yell out to the cellâ€¦

title: Not that great
review:
I got Deezer as an alternative to Spotify due to its enrichment of j*e r*gan but itâ€™s not fantastic and it keeps getting more expensive. The libraries are not well organized. As an example, a band or artist that may share a name with another artist is not necessarily in their own category. It is also infuriating that the music I have downloaded for offline use are not always available if there is not a wireless signal.

In my opinion Apple Music and Spotify offer better user experiences but if youâ€™re looking for an ethical way to listen to digital music, Bandcamp is my go to.

title: Playback interruptions
review:
Approx. since 2-3 versions back, the app starts to stop playback when it is in the background (while
iPhone open/in use and when closed/locked. When opening the app again, it loads/starts up with current queue still intact (most of the time). Happens frequently, +50% chance.

App sometimes freezes when trying to add song to playlist during playback. Playback continues but not clear if and when the app unfreezes, sometimes you have to close it to be able to use it again.

Also: When scrolling from the beginning of a song, you often skip to next song accidentally. Feels like an UX flaw, this doesnâ€™t happen on other apps.. :/

title: Love love love! Butâ€¦
review:
I cancelled my previous subscription with another platform and decided to try Tidal after great reviews from other music heads. 
Iâ€™ve pretty much tried everything, from Spotify, to Apple, to YouTube, and now Tidal. I love Tidal, the quality is as advertised and I found the app easy to navigate. 
My issue is rather small, just small tweaks that I would have loved, I found the music great but the personal experience not so much. Iâ€™m a creative person, I want to decorate my app with playlist covers and Tidal doesnâ€™t offer that. On every other platform it is a given because itâ€™s common that people want to get creative with their playlist. This at first didnâ€™t bother me but I soon realised my playlist covers work as a quick guide (I have well over 50 playlist). Iâ€™m a true music enjoyer to my core, I like to personalise my experience on any app I listen to music on and unfortunately Tidal doesnâ€™t offer much creativity. I find it to be a bit behind in the user experience compared to its competitors which I donâ€™t understand because for years listeners have voiced their concerns and added what they want to see on the streaming service platform. So although I love Tidal, the small things that add to a users experience did get to me eventually.

title: Recent App Update â€“ Poor Playback Experience
review:
Dear SoundCloud Team,

Iâ€™m writing to share my disappointment with the recent update to the SoundCloud app. Since updating, the overall experience has significantly worsened.

One major issue is that songs no longer play properly unless I remain inside the app. This also applies to adsâ€”they wonâ€™t play unless I actively keep the app open. This completely breaks the multitasking experience and makes using SoundCloud frustrating, especially when compared to how smooth it was before.

The forced in-app playback feels like a step backwards. I genuinely enjoyed using SoundCloud in the past, but this update has made the platform difficult to enjoy. I hope this is addressed soon, as the current setup is far from user-friendly.

Looking forward to improvements in future updates.

title: Good
review: Amazing app, some pointers tho. Why Does the app doesnt support 3D touch/ForceTouch? Does not make sense to me. Also, Tidal has the worst search engine ever. It favors popularity over the searchterm which makes lesser known songs harder to find. Other than that, I love it. Why did you change the color of the playing bar to white. It was nice to see in the details which level of audio quality you were listening to. Also the queue management is horrendous. How is it that I play an album and when I want to add another one in the queue, I can only press â€œplay nextâ€ which then plays the other album after the first song of the first album. And then when Iâ€™ve listened to the both of the albums, they stay exactly like that in the queue even if I start a song from a different source. The artists pages arenâ€™t managed well. Somebody can make a song as â€œTravis Scottâ€ and it will feature on the real Travisâ€™ page even though he has nothing to do with it

MÃªme chose avec le violoncelliste Emanuel Fauermann : aucun rÃ©sultat !
On cherche la bio de Caetano Veloso : nous la trouvonsâ€¦ en portugais ! Indigent.

Au sujet de votre maÃ®trise technologique, ce nâ€™est guÃ¨re mieux : votre Tidal Connect est Ã  la ramasse ! Ã€ la fin dâ€™une lecture dâ€™un album ou dâ€™une playlist souvent la connexion devient introuvable et le tidal Connect nâ€™est plus proposÃ©. MÃªme chose quand on ajoute des titres Ã  notre playlist on perd la connexion Tidal Connect : il faut tout dÃ©brancher, rÃ©initialiser la box et redÃ©marrer le streamer ! Une usine Ã  gaz !

Prenez exemple chez Spotify : oui qualitÃ© audio infÃ©rieure mais leur spotify connect fonctionne Ã  merveille !

Au prix de votre abonnement, câ€™est vraiment trÃ¨s trÃ¨s cher payÃ© pour un service aussi minable !

title: Great but with issues
review:
This streaming platform has been stuck in limbo these past years in regard to features improvements. Contemplating unsubscribing soon.

1) For the sake of sanity, can we have the ability to sort downloaded music by artist, album, playlist, etc? This is driving me nuts. All other major platforms have this feature.

2) Their music catalogue has inaccurate information and when reported, Tidal is not responding. For example, for artists with the same name, you often see albums attributed to the wrong artist. This ends in your mixes based on your preferences and can be frustrating.

3) Their tvOS app navigation menu is not displaying properly, often being hidden due to improper UI scaling. Also, when a video is playing, you donâ€™t see the artist and song name in the navigation menu. And when you go back to the playlist, it doesnâ€™t highlight the song actually playing.

title: Good but could improve
review:
The sound is great (better than any music app I tried), the look of Tidal is sleek and professional and I love how artists get more money per stream. However, there are three things that need major improvements. English is not my first language for apologies for any grammatical mistakes. 

1. Availability of custom images for playlists and profile picture. This is such a simple update that is not available and widely talked about online and offline. Some people refuse to use Tidal since custom abilities are not available. I would love to see this since the first 4 albums as cover art in a playlist makes it look messy. Second, I had to make a facebook account to change my profile picture, this was truly unnecessary.  

2. It is annoying that if you look up a song with 1 mistake (writing loce instead of love for example) will lose you the ability to search the song. Spotify is way better at this. Also, sometimes I search a song and it does not pop up at all, while knowing it is on Tidal. Then I have to go to the artist and search for the song in their catalog, this is also not optimal. 

3. It is great that there are many official playlists, however pushing user made playlists would be such an improvement. You have the option to make your playlist â€œpublicâ€ but no one will be able to see it since it wonâ€™t pop up, even if it has many artists you are interested in. I would like to see other actual people with the same interests besides getting a daily mix, it makes it more personal. 

These improvements would make this app 5 stars.

title: Love the appâ€™s style and platformâ€™s very own style, do wish there were hues of browns, golds, or blu
review:
I use this app. I run on appleâ€™s iOS and OS, recently i tried Appleâ€™s Music, Qobuz, Tidal, Spotify. None of them rivaled to Deezer in terms of music library total focus. I donâ€™t need video, moving Ã¡lbum pictures, or a news tap. My only complaint to Deezer are two things. 

1. Playlists are limited to 2,000 songs. I fâ€™n absolutely detest that. I love albums but Iâ€™m a huge playlists guy for every mood and vibe. But Iâ€™d love to be able to merger a few of my personal created playlist to 4,000 songs, better yet, give the customer its own ability to expand them 10k songs if they want to. Please, this is a failure to restrict playlist to 2,000 songs. Nope, it just isnâ€™t right. 

2. I highly considered tidal and qobus do to HI-RES Audio which sounds significantly better, but they lack cross fade and smooth page to page transitions, their platforms are also boring. Not even gonna talk about apply music, or Spotify. I feel them garbage and ADHD styled. lol please work on getting Hifi to HiRes and even Dolby. Everything else you guys are doing is fantastic tho. I have used more than half of my iPhones 1TB memory to access music offline when Iâ€™m mature. 

Absolutely love Deezer but have consider leaving for hires only havenâ€™t because other platforms are lacking focus, crossfade, we EQ, and sound check, Deezer offers that. Great job Deezer! Love yâ€™all.

title: Broken app
review:
I love tidal and what it stands for, but after putting up with the janky app for four years I'm considering a move to Apple music.

The app has improved over time but without fixing the fundamental problem of songs / Playlist not downloading.
Sometimes it downloads a Playlist, other times it doesn't, and when you add new songs to it it's a gamble wether or not it will download them for offline use or wether you'll have to delete the downloaded Playlist completely and try again from scratch.

The weekly discovery is great, and I love the audio quality, but fix your damn app tidal.

title: HiFi Sound
review:
Iâ€™ve subscribed to **Tidal** after testing Apple Music, Spotify, Amazon Music, and YouTube Music (my go-to for 2 years). Hereâ€™s the breakdown:  

âœ… **Why Tidal Wins for me:**  
- **Superior Sound Quality**: Perfectly paired with my AirPods Pro 2 and Sony WH-1000XM4, Tidalâ€™s Hi-Res/Master tracks deliver unmatched clarity.  
- **Audiophile Focus**: Lossless FLAC/MQA files (24-bit/192kHz) outperform Spotify/YouTube Musicâ€™s compressed formats.  
- **Exclusive Content**: Master Quality tracks, Dolby Atmos, and artist-centric features add depth to your listening.  

âš ï¸ **Key Drawback:**  
- **No Crossfade Feature**: Unlike Spotify (12-second crossfade), Tidal lacks this feature, which is frustrating.

title: Playlist management slow AF
review:
Organizing playlists is SLOW both in app and web. 

Why:
1) Can only add a single track between playlists at a time.
2) When adding a track to playlists, you have to scroll between HUGE thumbnails.
3) No sort, search or filter playlists when adding a track
4) No option to either add, move
6) Custom order of tracks exists<3, even though it can be slow for long playlists.
5) No playlist folders or orher means of organizing. I got creative and use a relative numbering system (01-99) (works alphabetically). 

However,

6) Platlist view does not remember my sort setting (alphabetical)!

Come on!

title: Pretty horrible
review:
This app has a lot of bugs, especially when it comes to downloading playlists and random freezes while playing. 

But for god's sake: it's 2025, give us some basic useful friendly features, like 
1. Being able to custom order your playlists!
2. Being able to SEARCH which playlist you want to add songs to!! (I know you know how to add it's in the desktop app)
3. Being able to move a playlist out of a folder (and not having to add it to another one)

I know a lot of people who want to move away from Spotify, but there's no way I can recommend them to downgrade to this rickety app.

title: Plus: Der Klang, Minus: Die App
review:
Ich schreibe nie Rezensionen, aber da ich eigentlich das Konzept von Tidal, ein wirklich grandioses Klangerlebnis zu ermÃ¶glichen, wunderbar finde, hoffe ich, dass man endlich die Probleme in dieser App in den Griff bekommt. Und ich kann mich wirklich nur anschlieÃŸen, dass der Sound einfach wunderbar ist. Das warâ€™s dann allerdings schon. Und das reicht auch leider nicht, um all die Probleme, die man mit dieser App hat, auszugleichen.

Abgesehen von Kleinigkeiten wie das fehlerhafte Laden von Inhalten, ein Bug hier und da in der Warteschlange und der schlechten ResponsivitÃ¤t des UI, gibt es doch Probleme die fÃ¼r mich inakzeptabel sind und auch der Grund, warum ich fÃ¼r diese App nicht mehr bezahlen mÃ¶chte.
ZunÃ¤chst sind da die Fake-Inhalte, die Ã¼ber zu lange ZeitrÃ¤ume in der App verfÃ¼gbar sind. Das ist an sich schon eine Katastrophe fÃ¼r KÃ¼nstler. Hinzu kommt, dass Inhalte so unÃ¼bersichtlich zur VerfÃ¼gung gestellt werden oder einfach Ã¼berhaupt nicht in der Suche auftauchen, dass man das GefÃ¼hl hat man, arbeite fÃ¼r den Rechercheverbund NDR, WDR und SZ, nur um den bekanntesten Titel eines bestimmten KÃ¼nstlers zu finde. Mal abgesehen davon, dass viele KÃ¼nstler mehrere Profile besitzen. Ich will gar nicht wissen, wie dabei die VergÃ¼tung fÃ¼r diese KÃ¼nstler ablÃ¤uft.
Des Weiteren werden willkÃ¼rliche Titel (es sind immer dieselben) einfach nicht heruntergeladen und halten die gesamte Warteschlange fÃ¼r Offline-Inhalte auf. 
Und wirklich schade - allerdings zu vertragen - ist fÃ¼r mich, dass man keine lokalen Titel in die Playlists integrieren kann. 

WofÃ¼r ich Tidal jedoch ehrlich dankbar bin, ist dass sie mir die Augen geÃ¶ffnet haben, was ich an QualitÃ¤t die letzten 15 Jahre verpasst habe.
Deshalb Danke!

title: Music. Pure and Simple.
review:
An app without an identity crisis. Apple Music puts 100% focus on music. Supporting Dolby AtmosÂ® and Lossless, the audio quality is simply unbeatable.

For those who love to analyze lyrics; its real-time lyrics view and the AI-driven Sing feature which eliminates the vocal track; you can sing along and focus on your own concert. If you prefer the occasional visual immersion; music videos are available and ready to put you closer to the artists vision.

The UI is simple and places focus on albums and your own library. This is in stark difference to the competition, which often pushes playlists, good and bad on you in excess. Of course, if playlists is your way of listening to music; there are there, but they are not the focus.

Q: What about pricing and tiers?
A: There are no ads, and best of all; no complicated pricing tiers. One subscription: 100-million songs.

Q: Is there a â€œWrappedâ€ at the end of year?
A: No. There is a â€œReplayâ€ and it is year-round. Every Monday, your Replay gets updated and every month, you can track your own statistics, share them, and discover more about your musical tastes. At the end of the year; youâ€™ll be given the opportunity to view your year as a whole. Replay is an auto-generated playlist, which you can add to your library.

Q: Can I try it for free?
A: Yes! Apple Music offers a 3-month free trial period. If you are dissatisfied, cancel in-time to avoid any charges at the end of your period.

â€”

I 100% recommend Apple Music. Itâ€™s an app for music fans and it does not try to be anything else. Itâ€™s all music, nothing more, nothing less.

Ovviamente le modalitÃ  non sono invitanti, anzi penso vi faccia perdere opportunitÃ , ma leggo anche una certa timidezza nel mostrare anche solo un pezzetto di un brano  di ciÃ² che offrite, con orgoglio.  Penso che non sia cosÃ¬ oneroso qualche minuto gratuito di musica privo del sapore  della â€œcambialeâ€ e alimentato dallâ€™ansia di chi si Ã¨ ritrovato nei bug di impossibilitÃ  di disdetta a prezzi maggiorati. Se credete nel prodotto perchÃ© metterlo cosÃ¬ nascosto. PerchÃ© non promuoverlo? SarÃ  pure una questione di non credere forse in ciÃ² che si vende, o una strana legge del marketing. They deny you a refund when purchased through Apple Pay and Apple Pay doesnâ€™t do refunds after a certain amount of days. Not going to suggest this service to anyone. title: Random functionality deceiving
review:
Been using the app for years now. 
The amount of artists is good. Occasionally unknown artists do not show up. Cannot check with other platforms to see how they fair relating to this aspect. App performance is usually good. It used to crash regularly, that seems to be fixed. Current bug is opening the app, switching to another during loading, and Deezer will show a blank screen. 
The main thing that really bothers me is the â€œshuffleâ€/â€œrandomâ€ mode. It is always the same queue when you apply this to a song. No matter what day, time, how you found the song or whatever. This also seems to apply to starting a â€œsong mixâ€. Iâ€™d hope it would mix differently every time, but it doesnâ€™t. I would like to see expansion here; more mixes leading to more different artists, songs and genres.

title: Spacial audio is unusable
review:
Playback of atmos tracks (at least via Apple TV) is unusable. Tracks are mastered 15-20dB below stereo tracks. 

I have a reference atmos cinema, where 0dB (my volume limit) is at cinema reference which this cinema is calibrated to. Stereo music at -10dB is loud (0dB is heading towards concert level). Movies are typically played at -10 to -5dB. 

Now Tidal atmos music at 0dB (max volume) is quiet so very little bass, and obviously crushed dynamic range. 

Iâ€™ve since found this is a well documented problem with Tidal not just on Apple TV but other hardware platforms. 

Not such problem with the native music service. 

Skip this service if you want to ever use spacial music.

title: Except for a few bugs, it is my favourite music streaming platform (along with Bandcamp)
review:
Except for a few bugs, it is my favourite music streaming platform (along with Bandcamp)

In term of bugs, the most annoying one is that I have to occasionally uninstall and reinstall the app to purge the excess of space my downloads take on my phone (even though I have carefully selected the low downloads option to listen to my music offline).

Second bugs; since at least a year or two, I no longer can add favourites to the songs I like. Itâ€™s like I reached too many likes. I am not sure why it does that. 

Other than that, it is a great app and I love the many and excellent curated playlists they offer and updates regularly to discover new music and artists. Why use AI algorithms to discover new music when such qualified people put together such brilliant playlist!?

I was working with thatâ€¦ but I went to all the trouble of downloading my songs, which bugged out and broke a few times, then got on a plane. The first flight I had musicâ€¦ the second it decided Iâ€™d logged out and therefore had nothing downloaded. I had no music the whole flight. The app I was using before has never logged me out unexpectedly and Iâ€™ve had music on many flights without issue. 

I wanted so badly to like you guys, but this service needs real work to be worth using.

title: Glitchy service
review: I have been a Tidal customer for many years, but I just canceled my subscription.  I also have Apple Lossless streaming and I find it superior to Tidal in most areas.  I noticed over the last few days that although an album says itâ€™s being streamed in lossless andâ€hi-resolutionâ€, it isnâ€™t.  My Chord Mojo and my Dragonfly Cobalt headphone DAC/amps have a colour indicator that identifies what the bitrate and sampling frequency is, so Tidal canâ€™t fool me.  Something must have happened in the last update?  My Apple Lossless platform works fine as it streams many of the same albums in hi-rez.  Iâ€™ve been in touch with their support team, but I canâ€™t be bothered to upload a video showing the problem as theyâ€™ve requested.

title: First rate sound, some minor flaws
review: I love the high resolution quality of the audio files. The selection is great- rarely canâ€™t find what I want. The â€˜suggestionsâ€™ algorithm is pretty good. My only problem is that both the app (on iOS) and using Tidal Connect are very unstable and often freeze when skipping/scrubbing tracks - often even requiring a reboot. It does not seem to have this problem if you just listen to a playlist or such without much interaction with the user interface. Despite this I have stuck with Tidal for a few years now, and have no intention of cancelling.

title: Continuous playback problem
review:
A very good player, great content quality! And Dolby Atmos works on all of my devicesğŸ‘
But there is an issue. There are some albums where songs should play one after another without pauses, like itâ€™s the one song. But in Tidal there are pauses between tracks and it kills all the experience, especially with live albums. Apple Music doesnâ€™t have this problem. Please fix it as soon as possible, maybe add prebuffpering of the next song while 10 last seconds of previous song is playing. 
And one more small thing. The audio format details are not shown in Google TV app (bit depth and sample rate), it says only HIGH or MAX. I would like to be able to see this information just like on my iOS devices. Thank you!

title: Gapless
review:
Hallo, ik heb sinds een week of 2 problemen met het afspelen van Tidal op mijn iPhone en iPad. Dit gaat niet meer gapless, wat dus vooral bij live-albums goed merkbaar is door de knip tussen de tracks.

Het afspelen via Tidal Connect naar Sonos gaat wel goed, afspelen via Apple TV en Windows laptop gaat ook goed.

Afspelen via Airplay naar Sonos geeft hetzelfde probleem, dus alles wat via iPhone of iPad gaat is niet meer gapless.

Afspelen via Apple Music gaat ook zonder problemen, maar ik geef toch de voorkeur aan Tidal (tenminste als dit probleem opgelost kan worden).

Ik heb hierover al contact gehad met support van Tidal en Apple en van alles geprobeerd, maar zonder resultaat. Apple adviseerde mij om contact op te nemen met de ontwikkelaar van de app. 

Hebben jullie enig idee wat de oorzaak/oplossing kan zijn?

Mvg,

Jos

title: One of the best apps
review:
I just got this app, first impressions, it looks like every other music app; SoundCloud, Spotify, and pandora. Apples music looks different but they both have nearly the same sound quality. The better surround/spatial sound goes to Deezer, the better Sound/voice quality goes to Apple Music. Itâ€™s a small difference but the vocals sound louder than Apple Music. Also yes, Deezer and Apple Music are better than Spotify. Deezer has easier to follow menus when clicking on artists and main menu. I have all of the best quality subscriptions on SoundCloud, Apple Music, Spotify, and Deezer. So I know what Iâ€™m talking about. You should go with Deezer if you love hearing those individual background noises and Apple Music if you want more clear vocals.
 
If I could, I would give this app a 4.5/5 stars but a 5/5 for the round up. Highly recommend!!

title: Very Happy With Tidal
review: I mainly use the Tidal app on an iPad where the interface looks amazing.  High quality streams fire directly to my streamer and audiophile quality HiFi system.  Sound quality is superb with a minimum of CD quality being streamed and often higher.  Great channel separation, soundstage and depth are all there in spades.  So refreshing after the never ending changes to Apple Music, where music suddenly disappears (yes, even the music Iâ€™ve ripped myself into it), patchy sound quality and other glitches. Never going backl!
Just great but Spotify better

title: It cleared my whole Library
review: I had iTunes long before Apple music. I had built a music library for many years. Downloaded songs, purchased albums, added songs my friends had produced etc. when I stopped paying for Apple Music, it has taken all my music away from me. Including CDs I bought and added way back when. Disgraceful Apple have stolen my digital property from me. No support anywhere, after reading many forums, My fears of never accessing that music again have come true. Iâ€™m disgusted. Heartbroken.

title: Canâ€™t download podcast part 2
review:
There seems to be a growing amount of people having the same problem with not being able to download podcasts. I have had a subscription for many years now and was having no problem until today. I searched on the Deezer community for an answer but the response from Deezer is pointless and unhelpful, if this isnâ€™t fixed in the next few days and addressed properly I will look to move my subscription elsewhere like hoards of other users.

In response to the developer reply I find it completely unacceptable that such a fundamental change has not been communicated to subscribers and that as a paying customer for many years I am now expected to pay the same amount for much less of an offering than I had before. I am able to download podcasts with other apps so this is what I will now do. Deezer has lost me as a customer and just doesnâ€™t seem to care.

title: Premium price, budget experience
review: Moved across when Neil young pulled his music from Spotify. Figured the high quality streams and higher percentage to artists was worth the increased price. But despite the premium price tag, the experience is generally lacklustre. Video playlists on tv are constantly buffering to the point of being unusable. No google home integration. Playlists, recommended and related track lists and are embarrassingly uninspired and often completely irrelevant. Really want to like this app but the quality of life issues make it really difficult to recommend at this point.

title: I have had deezer before.
review:
As the title says, Iâ€™ve had deezer before. It was fun until it was playing songs NOT on the album ?? Coming to present, it still happens! You canâ€™t listen to an album. It has to be similar songs like the album, or the song. You canâ€™t play it on command and I really done like that as I donâ€™t recognise any of these songs that come on. I canâ€™t use Apple Music nor YouTube Music because Apple Music isnâ€™t free, and YouTube Music wonâ€™t let me log in. Yet itâ€™s free, itâ€™s still buggy. title: SoundCloud is (not) a joke. I received amazing support!
review:
Iâ€™ve been using SoundCloud for a while to share my music with friends, family, and for my own enjoyment. Recently, I signed up for the Next Pro free trial to explore more features. However, I was suddenly logged out of my account, and when I tried to log back in, I discovered that my account had been completely deleted without any warning or explanation. Then I got an email that my Next Pro was canceled with a link to a survey asking me why I canceled my subscription. Whatâ€™s most frustrating is that I had two-factor authentication (2FA) enabled, and I always adhered to SoundCloudâ€™s terms of service. All my AI-created content was clearly labeled as AI, AI Covers had â€œAI Coversâ€ in the titles, and my music is deeply personal, addressing my experiences with mental health and addiction. Losing access to this content was both distressing and confusing, especially since my regular SoundCloud subscription through Apple was still active.

I reached out to SoundCloud support and initially did not receive a satisfactory explanation. I was deeply disappointed and frustrated by this experience. SoundCloud informed me that they had suspended my account because they detected automation, which I did not engage in. However, they have now reactivated my account, and I am incredibly grateful for the resolution. The support representative who handled my case was very empathetic and understanding, and they sincerely apologized for the inconvenience caused. They assured me that my account is secure and that this issue wonâ€™t happen again. Because of this positive experience and their prompt response to fix the issue, Iâ€™m happy to update my review from 1/5 to 5/5.

title: A barely functional app that endlessly breaks
review:
Tidal is a lovely idea in theory but a piece of junk in reality. Itâ€™s not so much production software as someoneâ€™s first year coding project brought to life. 

While the basics are fine, the implementation of subscriptions is dire - and this is from someone whoâ€™s been a subscriber since the app was launched. Really, itâ€™s inept. 

Iâ€™m continually being sent around and around in circles trying to login - and it doesnâ€™t matter if you use an email login or an Apple ID. Tidal will routinely forget your login, demand a new subscription, and lose all your tracks and playlists. Get used to being charged multiple times for the same subscription, and always being at risk of losing every single item youâ€™ve ever saved. 

The big attraction of Tidal has always been the hifi codecs including MQA. But with other apps moving to these, the case for Tidal gets worse every day. Had they put more effort into getting the basic subscription functionality right, Iâ€™d happily stay â€¦ but letâ€™s face it, no-one wants to be continually forced to recreate their account over and over again. So thatâ€™s a fail on the first year coding project, and a one-star review.

title: Doesnâ€™t maintain a connection

Iâ€™m using it on an iPad Air that isnâ€™t used for any other purpose except connecting to a Bluesound Node and the app will randomly lose its connection to the Node and revert to playing through the iPad speakers. It also loses the connection whenever the iPad goes to sleep, which makes it hard to play a playlist or album. Using the BluOS app with Tidal as a source works flawlessly, so itâ€™s the Tidal app which is the problem. Unfortunately with BluOSâ€™s UI/UX limitations this is a frustrating problem.

title: A good app (mostly) for a great product
review:
I generally enjoy using Tidal. High quality streaming that pays artists 50x per play over the other one.  The quality of recording and range of artists is such that I rarely miss content, and find that most bygone artists have their full discography.

There are a few things that I find frustrating â€” such as not being able to sort downloaded albums. I think the default is by download date ğŸ¤¯.

Another feature I would love is collapsible albums in the queue â€“ that can be dragged in any order. And adding a new song/ album adding at the end of the queueâ€¦just like real albums. But no apps have those features.

title: Deezer is confused on CarPlay
review: Iâ€™ve been a Deezer user for 7 years now. Iâ€™ve enjoyed the Hi-Fi experience ever since but thereâ€™s just one thing that has been irritating me more and more every month for good 3 years now. Deezer wonâ€™t always proceed playing music on CarPlay. Sometimes it requires me to start playing two different songs, sometimes it does not work and I have to manually play a song using the mobile app. Sometimes it loads the song, it looks like itâ€™s ready to play but nothing happens. Canâ€™t skip to another song, canâ€™t do anything. Once itâ€™s rolling, itâ€™s rolling. But sometimes itâ€™s just impossible to get it to work and I give up after 15 minutes because I need to focus on the road, not on a phone/multimedia display. If this is related to poor signal anyhow, then putting such info on the display would drastically improve the UX. Please do something about it.

3. Things completely out of your comfort zone
These three things i think should be in different sections of the explore tab

title: Maybe some of the worst optimisation issues Iâ€™ve experienced
review:
I recently swapped to tidal from Spotify because of recent subscription prices changing, tidal supporting artists better and features that annoyed me so much from Spotify but only after a few days can I say this was by far the worse decision Iâ€™ve made. 

Sure the better audio quality is good but is it really worth it? Listening on multiple different audio devices. I can barely tell the difference, which considering this costs more then Spotify and is one of itâ€™s main selling point is quite disappointing.

The app performance is actually abysmal. The app doesnâ€™t often register when I try to play a song, wonâ€™t turn shuffle on after tapping it maybe 5 times; would lag when I tried to swap playlists that I was listening to, would quite often not add a song to a playlist and then Iâ€™m left confused on where the song is and many more optimisation issues. For a music streaming app this piss poor optimisation when it comes to doing the thing itâ€™s made for, listening to music, is genuinely astonishing.

I will be returning to Spotify, which saddens me, because I did want to support artists better but I feel like Iâ€™m being absolutely ripped off here. I donâ€™t get all the praise this app gets when it works like absolute trash.

title: Buggy Google Cast
review:
If a music is played on an external device using the Google Cast protocol and the Deezer app is sent to the background, then after comming back to Deezer it seems to have lost connection with a device playing music. Clicking pause/play causes the music to start playing on iPad and the process of starting Google Cast playback has to be repeated.
Secondly, if a music is played using Google Cast, then a new track canâ€™t be added to a current queue using the â€Play nextâ€ option (itâ€™s missing). When music is played directly on an iPad, then â€Play nextâ€ option is availableâ€.

title: Why?
review: The king is dead. Iâ€™ll never understand why Deezer decided to sabotage their own app, taking it from the best to worst streaming app overnight. Long live Queen Spotify.

title: I wanted to like it
review:
Got free trial after purchasing Sony earbuds. Iâ€™ve been using YouTube Music for few years and really like it but decided to give Deezer a try. Also tried Tidal, Spotify and Apple Music. 

App seems more feature-rich than YTM and more usable than Apple Music. Reminds me of Spotify in that thereâ€™s loads of playlists to choose from. Love the hifi sound quality and that it pays artists more than some other streaming services. Also European tech companies ftw. 

So whatâ€™s wrong? The app is slow. Like really slow. Starting a song takes several seconds and often results into warning message of long loading times. It also doesnâ€™t seem to learn my taste despite using it pretty much every day for some time. I often have to skip some random annoying pop song Deezer seems to love. 

YTM knew me basically from day one and Iâ€™ve gotten used to not needing to babysit my music app. Also I listen to a lot of electronic music and hip hop and love, love, love the idea that my music service has all those remixes, live sets etc. I might want even if there arenâ€™t any â€œofficialâ€ albums. 

Itâ€™s not that Deezer is bad. Might choose it over Spotify, Apple Music etc. for the app features and artist payouts alone. But for me YTM just gets out of the way and does what I want without me needing to think about it.

title: Itâ€™s music, not politics
review:
Iâ€™ve been using Deezer since 2018 enjoying it, collecting music, and creating playlists. Flow was nice, functionally too. But then they simply disconnected my account from premium within 1 day, since it was identified as Russian. Just saying: Deezer is no longer available in your country. Even though for several last years Iâ€™ve been living in Sweden, itâ€™s not the point Iâ€™d like to emphasize. They did it in relation to the war in Ukraine, but how are simple civilian people, enjoying music, related to this?! The music and art in general are those things that vise versa help people to push away the aggression from their minds, to find peace and refuse the war. Moreover, itâ€™s very nationalistic â€” disconnecting people simply because they belong to some nation.
I love music anyway, so I just switched to Spotify since their ethical standards are obviously at another level.

title: Better than Google Music
review: Was forced to look for a new streaming music provider after Google Music died. Deezer does everything I need. Playlist and new music suggestions/notifications are pretty good, and no issues so far finding obscure tracks. The interface is pleasing to the eye. I like that they so far havenâ€™t defaulted to black background.

title: The best music streaming app
review: I have tried them all, and Deezer is the best. You have all the music, a superb and sleek UX. The high resolution plan is half price compared to Tidal. And most importantly the app is actually good for discovering interesting stuff to listen to. All other platforms stuff you with soulless EDM - virtually every song on Spotify sounds the same. Try to search Spotify for â€œrock â€œ and what you will get is hip hop and EDM. Deezer actually gives you all kinds of music and not just the stuff the record labels pay to promote.
